alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marion; Morrow; Richland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Richland, southern Marion, Morrow and western Knox Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waldo, or 10 miles southeast of Marion, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Mount Gilead, Fredericktown, Cardington, Bellville, Centerburg, Ashley, Prospect, Waldo, Chesterville, Sparta, Waterford, Edison, Green Camp, Marengo, Fulton and State Route 229 at US Route 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
